      Maximum multiplier value for estimated initial variance to estimate best intervals.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_INITIAL_SAMPLES

        private static final int DEFAULT_INITIAL_SAMPLES
        Initial number of samples to be measured to obtain level of accelerometer noise.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_INITIAL_VARIANCE_THRESHOLD_MULTIPLIER

        private static final int DEFAULT_MAX_INITIAL_VARIANCE_THRESHOLD_MULTIPLIER
        Default maximum threshold multiplier value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mTimeInterval

        private double mTimeInterval
        Time internal between kinematics samples expressed in seconds (s).

      • mInitialSamples

        private int mInitialSamples
        Total samples to be processed during initial interval.

      • mInitialIntervalCompleted

        private boolean mInitialIntervalCompleted
        Indicates whether initial interval has already been completed.

      • mInitialAccelerometerVariance

        private double mInitialAccelerometerVariance
        Estimated accelerometer variance during initial interval expressed in (m^2/s^4).

      • mMaxInitialAccelerometerVariance

        private java.lang.Double mMaxInitialAccelerometerVariance
        Maximum allowed accelerometer variance during initial interval. During initial interval IMU is supposed to be static. If variance exceeds this value (because IMU is too noisy or a sudden movement occurs), then the detector will notify an error and reset. If this value is null, no limit is imposed on allowed initial accelerometer variance.

      • mMaxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier

        private int mMaxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier
        Maximum multiplier value for estimated initial variance to estimate best intervals.

      • mRunning

        private boolean mRunning
        Indicates whether this detector is running. The detector is considered to be running from the moment the first kinematics measure is added until calibration is completed or fails, or the detector is reset.

      • mListener

        private IMUEasyCalibratorIntervalDetectorListener mListener
        Listener to notify completion of intervals, calibration and errors.

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Indicates whether this detector is running or not. The detector is considered to be running from the moment the first kinematics measure is added until calibration is completed or fails, or the detector is reset.
        Returns:
        true if the detector is running, false otherwise.

      • getTimeInterval

        public double getTimeInterval()
        Gets time interval between kinematics samples expressed in seconds (s).
        Returns:
        time interval between kinematics samples.

      • setTimeInterval

        public void setTimeInterval​(double timeInterval)
                     throws LockedException
        Sets time interval between kinematics samples expressed in seconds (s).
        Parameters:
        timeInterval - time interval between kinematics samples.
        Throws:
        LockedException - if detector is running.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if provided value is zero or negative.

      • getInitialAccelerometerVariance

        public double getInitialAccelerometerVariance()
        Gets estimated initial accelerometer variance expressed in (m^2/s^4).
        Returns:
        estimated initial accelerometer variance.

      • getMaxInitialAccelerometerVariance

        public java.lang.Double getMaxInitialAccelerometerVariance()
        Gets maximum allowed accelerometer variance during initial interval. During initial interval IMU is supposed to be static. If variance exceeds this value (because IMU is too noisy or a sudden movement occurs), then the detector will notify an error and reset. If this value is null, no limit is imposed on allowed initial accelerometer variance.
        Returns:
        maximum allowed accelerometer variance.

      • setMaximumInitialAccelerometerVariance

        public void setMaximumInitialAccelerometerVariance​(java.lang.Double maximumInitialAccelerometerVariance)
                                            throws LockedException
        Sets maximum allowed accelerometer variance during initial interval. During initial interval IMU is supposed to be static. If variance exceeds this value (because IMU is too noisy or a sudden movement occurs), then the detector will notify an error and reset. If this value is null, no limit is imposed on allowed initial accelerometer variance.
        Parameters:
        maximumInitialAccelerometerVariance - maximum allowed accelerometer variance or null.
        Throws:
        LockedException - if detector is running.

      • getMaxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier

        public int getMaxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier()
        Gets maximum multiplier value for estimated initial variance to estimate best intervals.
        Returns:
        maximum multiplier value for estimated initial variance.

      • setMaxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier

        public void setMaxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier​(int maxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier)
                                              throws LockedException
        Sets maixmum multiplier value for estimated initial variance to estimate best intervals.
        Parameters:
        maxInitialVarianceThresholdMultiplier - maximum multiplier value for estimated initial variance.
        Throws:
        LockedException - if detector is running.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if provided value is less than 1.

      • getListener

        public IMUEasyCalibratorIntervalDetectorListener getListener()
        Gets listener to notify completion of intervals, calibration and errors.
        Returns:
        listener to notify events.

        Adds a body kinematics measure (accelerometer + gyroscope) to be processed by this detector.
